caption: Paul Coffey set a #NHL record that still stands today 28 years ago yesterday when he scored his 47th goal of the 1985-86 season. The #Oilers d-man surpassed Bobby Orr's 46-goal season from 11 years prior and finished with 48 tallies, the most goals by a blueliner in a single season. Coffey also had a career-best 138 points.  #TBT #ThrowbackThursday

caption: What a day for Olympic hockey! #TeamCanada survives a scare from Latvia to win 2-1, will face #TeamUSA in Friday's semifinal round. Meanwhile, #Hemsky scored both Czech goals in a 5-2 loss to the Americans, and #Belov's host Russians were eliminated by Finland 3-1. #Oilers #Sochi2014
caption_raw: What a day for Olympic hockey! #TeamCanada survives a scare from Latvia to win 2-1, will face #TeamUSA in Friday's semifinal round. Meanwhile, #Hemsky scored both Czech goals in a 5-2 loss to the Americans, and #Belov's host Russians were eliminated by Finland 3-1. #Oilers #Sochi2014

caption: Slovakia's bid for a medal at #Sochi2014 came to an end today with a 5-3 loss to the Czech Republic, but we couldn't be more proud of how blueliner Martin Marincin represented himself and the  # Oilers  in Sochi, playing more than 17 minutes per game against the world's top players. Today is also his 22nd birthday! Happy birthday, Marty!
caption_raw: Slovakia's bid for a medal at #Sochi2014 came to an end today with a 5-3 loss to the Czech Republic, but we couldn't be more proud of how blueliner Martin Marincin represented himself and the ‪#‎Oilers‬ in Sochi, playing more than 17 minutes per game against the world's top players. Today is also his 22nd birthday! Happy birthday, Marty!

caption: The @CityofEdmonton  and Katz Group announced today the $480 million Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) for Rogers Place has been met. Construction on the arena will begin in March 2014 and the entire project, scheduled to open in fall 2016, will become a landmark in Edmonton s downtown. Full details at RogersPlace.com.
caption_raw: The @CityofEdmonton﻿ and Katz Group announced today the $480 million Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) for Rogers Place has been met. Construction on the arena will begin in March 2014 and the entire project, scheduled to open in fall 2016, will become a landmark in Edmonton’s downtown. Full details at RogersPlace.com.
